reportText: Everyone knows that debugging is twice as hard as writing a program in the first place. So if you're as clever as you can be when you write it, how will you ever debug it?
Some of the best programming is done on paper, really. Putting it into the computer is just a minor detail.
When you don't create things, you become defined by your tastes rather than ability. Your tastes only narrow & exclude people. So create.
I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
Dog found walking across the street.
White cat with a caller spotted laying under a tree.
I saw a dog who looked lost in the parkign lot. It was medium sized and appeared to be mixed with a poodle.
There was a large dalmation seen running around the school yard. It had a red collar.
I found a black cat with blue collar hiding behind a large trash bin.
I saw a turtle on the sidewalk. This is unusual so I figured it might belong to someone .
